About Me

I am currently pursuing a Masterâ€™s degree in Mechanical Engineering at the Georgia Institute of Technology, where my research interests lies towards control systems, locomotion, manipulation, state estimation, optimization, and robot-focused mechanical design. I also earned my Bachelorâ€™s degree in Mechanical Engineering from Georgia Tech. During my undergraduate years, I explored a broad range of mechanical engineering disciplines through coursework, research, and student organizations. Over time, this exploration converged into a strong interest in robotics and autonomous systems, which became clear during the summer of 2025. Since then, I have focused my work on the mathematical and control-theoretic foundations of robotic systems.

I was born in Orlando, Florida, grew up in Tampa, and later lived in Hyderabad, India for 12 years where I did my schooling. I returned to the U.S. for college and now consider Georgia home.
